formatDescription:
The National Imagery Transmission Format Standard (NITFS) is the standard for formatting
digital imagery and imagery-related products and exchanging them among members of the US Intelligence
Community (IC) and other departments and agencies of the United States Government. The NITF provides a common basis for storage and digital interchange of images and associated data. The NITF can be used as a standard message format for dissemination of images and associated data (text, symbols, labels) via digital communications.
provenanceCompoundName: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

internalSignatures.name: National Imagery Transmission Format 2.0
internalSignatures.note: File Profile and name version declaration, followed by numercial complexity level (2 bytes), followed by 4 resereved bytes, followed by originating station id, followed by 14 byte file date and time sequence in form DDHHMMSSz(MON)YY, followed by 72 byte length file title alphanumeric sequence with 8 additional space bytes,to 1 byte file security classification declaration (T|S|C|R|U)
